instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.P3V3S4_EN: What is P3V3S4_EN? P3V3S4_EN is a signal that enables the PP3V3_S4 power rail when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Board got liquid damage and there is no trackpad/keyboard.
Tested with good known keyboard/trackpad and trackpad flex.

Board booting fine.

<SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> is missing (no short to ground)

If I understand correct power line for TPAD is created from <SIGNAL>PPBUS_X239_REG</SIGNAL>.

<TRANSISTOR>Q7979</TRANSISTOR> Measurements with keyboard/trackpad connected
pins 1,2,3 @ 10.95V
pin 4 @ 11.25V
pin 5 @ 0.002V
Resistance on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_X239_REG</SIGNAL>, 74.4K, Diode mode 0.505V

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
That voltage is controlled by <SIGNAL>SMC_ACTUATOR_DISABLE_L</SIGNAL>, if <RESISTOR>R7922</RESISTOR> is soldered.

Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> signal; must be high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
Then pin 4/<TRANSISTOR>Q7979</TRANSISTOR> should be low.
If not, check <RESISTOR>R7970</RESISTOR> and post <TRANSISTOR>Q7972</TRANSISTOR> voltages.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD</SIGNAL> missing
threads.message:
4/<TRANSISTOR>Q7979</TRANSISTOR> @ 10.20V
<RESISTOR>R7970</RESISTOR> @ 33K

1/<TRANSISTOR>Q7972</TRANSISTOR> @ 0.080V
3/<TRANSISTOR>Q7972</TRANSISTOR> @ 10.26V

<RESISTOR>R7976</RESISTOR>/22/26 are OK



SOLVED
<CHIP>U8000</CHIP> was faulty.
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4_P3V3S4FET</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>P3V3S4_EN</SIGNAL> was present but 0V on output. Replaced <CHIP>U8000</CHIP> and all works fine now.
